column4: can someone tell me what the CL command is for "showing an application"?
like "restoring" it
an application that is already running
You mean like...restoring an application window? Unminimizing it?
Well - can't your alt-tab to it?
Have you tried typing ggl-gtk from a terminal?
I suspect you have gnome. Please try: ggl-gtk
how do i uninstall ggl-qt then?

If you install an application that uses the qt widgets (which is the one used by the KDE environment), then the qt libraries will be installed as, regardless of whether you're using gnome or kde. And that is why you see the QT4 settings in gnome
If it didn't report any errors, then you should be ok. :)
Are you trying to install google gadgets?
You had the wrong version installed. Try sudo apt-get install google-gadgets-gtk now.
After running this command, "Google Gadgets" should show up in Applications -> Internet
Ignore that for the moment.
It's probably a left-over menu reference. :)
I think you can get rid of it if you right-click on your menu and edit it - I don't remember the exact steps, but you have to untick the checkmark next to it to make it go away.
Okay. Can you type dpkg -l | ggl, copy the results, go to pastebin.ubuntu.com, paste the results there, and post the link here?
Please don't delete files directly from /usr/bin - it doesn't work that way.
Type dpkg -l | ggl, copy the results, go to pastebin.ubuntu.com, paste the results there, and post the link here.
sorry, it's paste.ubuntu.com
Type dpkg -l | ggl, copy the results, go to pastebin.ubuntu.com, paste the results there, and post the link here.
dpgk command not found
It's dp*kg* -l | grep ggl
